name: radically

radically adverb
(COMPLETELY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
C1 completely or extremely: The accident radically changed the course of his life. Our approach is radically different to that of our competitors.
More examplesFewer examplesThey propose a radically different way of measuring economic progress.He had surgery to radically alter his appearance.Barker introduced some radically new ideas.Women who stop smoking radically reduce the risk of death from coronary heart disease within five years.

radically adverb
(IN POLITICS)
in a way that supports or relates to the belief that there should be great or extreme social or political change: Applegarth, a radically minded Liberal, was at the centre of all the political and industrial issues of the 1860s. We need to think more radically to solve these problems.
More examplesFewer examplesThey are a radically modernizing university.The movement was subsumed by the even more radically left Greens.
